p: Given that disasters are potentially embedded in implementation of socio-economic policies and interventions formulated to manage climate change, it is posited that failure to identify, quantify and treat risks embedded in dairy feeding adaptation initiatives actually enhances climate change risks and exacerbates small-scale farmersâ€™ vulnerability to climate change and weather variability (Volenzo 2015). Adaptation may result in suboptimal outcomes and unintended adverse impacts for other sectors.
